forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. West wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Memorial Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 62. West wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries the chill of the West, layered over the already captivating cityscape. With temperatures dipping to a mild 53 degrees, the clouds cast a gentle veil over the evening, creating an ambiance almost dreamlike. The winds whisper through the streets at 7 to 14 mph, bringing with them the salty kiss of the bay, with occasional gusts teasing at 22 mph. Against this backdrop, pockets of fog may linger in the familiar crevices, softening the edges of iconic landmarks and offering a familiar, comforting embrace that is quintessentially San Franciscan.

Tomorrow heralds the promise of a brighter day, where the sun will grace the city with its warm embrace, pushing temperatures up to about 62. The winds will similarly carry on, a pleasant reminder of the bay’s influence, while the clouds dissipate to reveal a clearer sky. Dressing in layers will be prudent—a cozy sweater accompanied by a windbreaker might be just the ticket for those venturing outside. With such inviting conditions on a holiday, a stroll along the waterfront or perhaps a gentle hike at Lands End could be ideal for soaking up the beauty of the surroundings, as the sunlight splashes warmly on the city’s ornate structures. An engaging evening awaits, ready to unfold beneath the canvas of the night sky.
